column2: A preface to the first edition of "Jane Eyre" being unnecessary, I gave none: this second edition demands a few words both of acknowledgment and miscellaneous remark.
column3: A preface to the first edition of "Jane Eyre" being unnecessary, I gave none: this second edition demands a few words both of acknowledgment and miscellaneous remark.

column2: My thanks are due in three quarters.
column3: My thanks are due in three quarters.

column2: To the Public, for the indulgent ear it has inclined to a plain tale with few pretensions.
column3: To the Public, for the indulgent ear it has inclined to a plain tale with few pretensions.

column2: To the Press, for the fair field its honest suffrage has opened to an obscure aspirant.
column3: To the Press, for the fair field its honest suffrage has opened to an obscure aspirant.

column2: I mean the timorous or carping few who doubt the tendency of such books as "Jane Eyre:" in whose eyes whatever is unusual is wrong; whose ears detect in each protest against bigotry--that parent of crime--an insult to piety, that regent of God on earth.
column3: I mean the timorous or carping few who doubt the tendency of such books as "Jane Eyre:" in whose eyes whatever is unusual is wrong; whose ears detect in each protest against bigotry-that parent of crime-an insult to piety, that regent of God on earth.

column2: To attack the first is not to assail the last.
column3: To attack the first is not to assail the last.

column2: Men too often confound them: they should not be confounded: appearance should not be mistaken for truth; narrow human doctrines, that only tend to elate and magnify a few, should not be substituted for the world-redeeming creed of Christ.
column3: Men too often confound them: they should not be confounded: appearance should not be mistaken for truth; narrow human doctrines, that only tend to elate and magnify a few, should not be substituted for the world redeeming creed of Christ.

column2: The world may not like to see these ideas dissevered, for it has been accustomed to blend them; finding it convenient to make external show pass for sterling worth--to let white-washed walls vouch for clean shrines.
column3: The world may not like to see these ideas dissevered, for it has been accustomed to blend them; finding it convenient to make external show pass for sterling worth-to let white washed walls vouch for clean shrines.

column2: Why have I alluded to this man?
column3: Why have I alluded to this man?

column2: They say he is like Fielding: they talk of his wit, humour, comic powers.
column3: They say he is like Fielding: they talk of his wit, humour, comic powers.

column2: Finally, I have alluded to Mr. Thackeray, because to him--if he will accept the tribute of a total stranger--I have dedicated this second edition of "JANE EYRE."
column3: Finally, I have alluded to mr Thackeray, because to him-if he will accept the tribute of a total stranger-I have dedicated this second edition of "JANE EYRE."

column2: If, therefore, the authorship of other works of fiction has been attributed to me, an honour is awarded where it is not merited; and consequently, denied where it is justly due.
column3: If, therefore, the authorship of other works of fiction has been attributed to me, an honour is awarded where it is not merited; and consequently, denied where it is justly due.
